text:
All HTTP access has been wipped, can't access web server using any domains
contained in virtualhost directives, nor by directly accessing IP address.
Access Log indicates malicous hex code in attempt to hack server. Google
searches match it to an IIS WebDAV exploit, however its caused Apache to no
longer function, possibly due to OS being Windows XP.

Lots of Hex in access.log file and interesting line found: 

84.67.38.8 - - [24/Mar/2005:20:48:28 +0000] "POST /_vti_bin/_vti_aut/fp30reg.dll
HTTP/1.1" 302 331

Server doesn't use CGI, only serves HTML and PHP, with MySQL backending.
Recently added mod_ssl and OpenSSL, but has functioned fine since this attack.
creator: chaz@chaz.hopto.org
jorton@redhat.com
text:
There are no details here which diagnose any httpd software issue; try
http://httpd.apache.org/lists.html#users-list if you need help to correctly
configure the server.
